comment.author: 54968992@N03
comment._content: A man interupted in his work, lol. Nice shot and a wry smile. Full of character.

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: And no windeyuppey telephone in sight!  Just a dial phone in solid black bakelite!

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Or is that a bottle of ink?

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: No Niall, I don't think that it is Irel!  Their bottles were rectangular whereas that appears to be octagonal.  If I remember my bottles right that was a bottle used for Goodalls Salad Cream or perhaps Goodalls Tomato Kechup, the shape of the bottle is right as is the label.  I suspect that Mr. McCollins (never heard of that surname before) had something else in it such as tea or coffee?

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: I wonder if he was named Robert, or maybe  William?

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/nlireland] As [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] says, it's not a common name. There were only 6 McCollinseses in the 1911 census, and only two of them could be this one: Robert, who would be 53 in 1960, and William, who would be 56. But of course, we have no particular reason to suppose this one was living in Ireland in 1911.

comment.author: 52585175@N07
comment._content: A diligent man, I would say!
